Package com.jmill29.tvtrackerapi.dao

Class UserDaoImpl

java.lang.Object
com.jmill29.tvtrackerapi.dao.UserDaoImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserDao
@Repository public class UserDaoImpl extends Object implements UserDao
JDBC-based implementation of the UserDao interface for managing user data in the database.

Provides methods for CRUD operations and user lookups using direct JDBC queries.

  • Method Details

    • findById

      public Optional<UserResponse> findById(int id) throws SQLException
      Finds a user by their unique ID.

      Searches the database for a user with the specified ID and returns the corresponding UserResponse wrapped in an Optional, or an empty Optional if no user is found.

      Specified by:
      findById in interface UserDao
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to find
      Returns:
      an Optional<UserResponse> if the user exists, or Optional.empty() otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • findByUsername

      public Optional<UserResponse> findByUsername(String username) throws SQLException
      Finds a user by their username.

      Searches the database for a user with the given username. This is typically used during authentication.

      Specified by:
      findByUsername in interface UserDao
      Parameters:
      username - the username to search for
      Returns:
      an Optional<UserResponse> if the user exists, or Optional.empty() otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • findAll

      public List<UserResponse> findAll() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all users from the database.

      Returns a list of all users as UserResponse objects, excluding sensitive fields such as passwords.

      Specified by:
      findAll in interface UserDao
      Returns:
      a List<UserResponse> of all users in the system
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • save

      public boolean save(User user) throws SQLException, UserAlreadyExistsException, UserNotFoundException
      Saves a user to the database.

      If the userId of the given User object is 0, a new user is inserted. Otherwise, the existing user is updated based on their ID.

      Specified by:
      save in interface UserDao
      Parameters:
      user - the User object to insert or update
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      UserAlreadyExistsException - if the user already exists when attempting to create a new user
      UserNotFoundException - if the user does not exist when attempting to update

    • deleteById

      public boolean deleteById(int id) throws SQLException
      Deletes a user by their unique ID.

      Removes the user record with the given ID from the database.

      Specified by:
      deleteById in interface UserDao
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to delete
      Returns:
      true if the user was deleted successfully, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • assignRoleToUser

      public boolean assignRoleToUser(String username, String role) throws SQLException
      Assigns a role to a user in the database.

      This method associates the specified role with the user identified by the given username. It is typically used to grant permissions or access levels to users after creation.

      Implementation notes:

      • Inserts a new row into the authorities table to associate the given role with the specified username.
      • If the user already has the role, this may result in a duplicate key or constraint violation depending on the schema.
      • Returns true if the role was assigned (row inserted), false otherwise.
      • Throws SQLException if a database error occurs (e.g., user does not exist, constraint violation).
      Specified by:
      assignRoleToUser in interface UserDao
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to whom the role will be assigned
      role - the role to assign (e.g., "ROLE_USER", "ROLE_ADMIN")
      Returns:
      true if the role was successfully assigned, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      See Also:
      • UserDao.assignRoleToUser(String, String)
